item.title: Beijing refuses to let chief Carrie Lam step down...
item.description:
news.google.com
Hong Kongâ€™s chief executive Carrie Lam has offered to resign on several occasions in recent weeks over mass protests in the territory but Beijing has refused to let her stand down, according to two people with direct knowledge of the situation. The demonstrations were sparked by an attempt by Ms Lam to push through an extradition bill that would allow criminal suspects to be sent to mainland China for trial, with public opposition so heated protesters stormed the territoryâ€™s de facto parliament this month.
